meanings.definition: To make someone or something seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent1: She would often belittle her classmates' achievements.
meanings.sent2: It is not kind to belittle others for their mistakes.
meanings.sent3: He would belittle his own accomplishments to make others feel better.
meanings.sent4: The constant belittling of her efforts chipped away at her confidence.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's harsh words belittled the student's hard work.

meanings.definition: To speak about someone or something in a way that makes them seem less impressive or important.
meanings.sent1: The politician tried to belittle his opponent's experience.
meanings.sent2: It is hurtful to belittle someone behind their back.
meanings.sent3: She would belittle her own talents to avoid attention.
meanings.sent4: The media's constant belittling of the actor's performance was unfair.
meanings.sent5: His sarcastic remarks belittled the efforts of the entire team.
